item.title: Today’s Wordle Hints, Help, And Answer—Game #1536 Solution
item.content:encoded:
Every day, Wordle fans around the world log in to guess the five-letter word of the day. Whether you’re a seasoned player or just starting out, knowing today’s hints and strategies can help you solve Wordle faster and improve your daily streak. Of course, that’s if you don’t mind the extra assistance. In this article, we’ll share helpful hints, tips on how to play, today’s Wordle answer (Game #1536), and yesterday’s solution for comparison.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you just want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here.

NOTE: The following information will include spoilers on today’s, and yesterday’s, edition of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily online word puzzle created by Josh Wardle, who first created the game as a prototype in 2013 and released it in 2021. It challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six attempts or fewer, using clues from previous guesses. The game became a viral hit in late 2021 due to its simplicity, shareable results, and the excitement of solving a new puzzle every day. Wordle has even inspired countless spin-offs and daily challenges across social media.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players get six attempts to guess the five-letter word answer. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a trending topic online.

When Do Wordle Games Reset

A new word is added to Wordle every day at 12am or Midnight EST.

Tips On How To Play

While everyone has a different strategy for how they play the game to get today’s Wordle answer, there are tips and tricks you can use to help you get the daily words in as few attempts as possible.

  • Tip 1: Use a word with common vowels and consonants (like SLATE or STRAW) to reveal useful letters early.
  • Tip 2: Don’t just rearrange your first word to find the answer. If you don’t know it right away, pick a second word that uses different letters you haven’t tried yet. This will help you narrow down your options quicker.
  • Tip 3: Don’t use duplicate letters too early. If you think a word has a duplicate letter, wait until you’re more confident the letter appears twice in the word.
  • Tip 4: Wait on uncommon letters. To make it easier, try and find all the common letters first. Once you’ve ruled out any common vowels or consonants, then give letters like “J”, “X”, or “Z” a try.

Hint for Today’s Wordle Answer—Game #1536

Without giving the Wordle answer completely away just yet, here are a couple helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: Today’s Wordle answer starts with the letter “M”
  • Hint 2: Today’s Wordle answer has just one vowel
  • Hint 3: It’s another word for “power”

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1536 for September 2, 2025.

Today’s Wordle Answer For September 2, 2025—Game #1536

If you’ve tried everything, including looking at the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: MIGHT

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

For reference, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1535:

Answer: LEAST

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles.

Past Wordle Answers

If you have a New York Times subscription, you can play past games of Wordle that you may have missed. If you found yourself stuck or couldn’t figure out the answers, you can find the last 30 Wordle answers by opening the dropdown below.

Recent Wordle Answers
  • Wordle #1,535 (September 1, 2025): LEAST
  • Wordle #1,534 (August 31, 2025): PETAL
  • Wordle #1,533 (August 30, 2025): ELATE
  • Wordle #1,532 (August 29, 2025): GRAFT
  • Wordle #1,531 (August 28, 2025): SPLIT
  • Wordle #1,530 (August 27, 2025): TOWER
  • Wordle #1,529 (August 26, 2025): ANNEX
  • Wordle #1,528 (August 25, 2025): MIRTH
  • Wordle #1,527 (August 24, 2025): SPORE
  • Wordle #1,526 (August 23, 2025): UNION
  • Wordle #1,525 (August 22, 2025): RATTY
  • Wordle #1,524 (August 21, 2025): EXTOL
  • Wordle #1,523 (August 20, 2025): LLAMA
  • Wordle #1,522 (August 19, 2025): ROWDY
  • Wordle #1,521 (August 18, 2025): ISSUE
  • Wordle #1,520 (August 17, 2025): LOUSY
  • Wordle #1,519 (August 16, 2025): MATTE
  • Wordle #1,518 (August 15, 2025): LEVEL

item.title: Cyberpunk 2077 Message Teases Something Coming on September 4
item.content:encoded:
CDPR has posted a message on social media teasing something related to Cyberpunk 2077 coming on September 4. The message is in the form of a notice issued by the N.U.S.A., the fictional government in Cyberpunk 2077’s universe. It speaks about a ‘mounting cybersecurity threat’ and invites ‘netrunners’ to battle against that rising danger.

Many theories have surfaced, and the leading belief is that CDPR is referring to cybersecurity-related job vacancies opening up in the near future. If that’s the case, why doesn’t the post link to any job listings, and why is it referencing a date three days in the future?

Is Something New Coming to Cyberpunk 2077?

In a post on social media, CDPR adopted the persona of President Rosalind Myers of The New United States of America. The message the team published seemed to be asking for netrunners (a fancy Cyberpunk term for hackers) to join the N.U.S.A. and help defend against ‘viciously determined’ threat actors.

The most curious thing about this post was the header, which mentioned a date: September 4, 2025.

It’s not clear if this was a) posted early, b) written in error, or c) teasing something being imminently revealed on Thursday.

In the comments under the post, Cyberpunk 2077 fans started sharing theories. Some users believe it’s something to do with the second season of Edgerunners, while others feel it’s something tied to Phantom Liberty, the first and only Cyberpunk 2077 expansion.

It could be something linked to Project Orion, the next Cyberpunk game. Again, it could just be a fancy post lining up the delivery of some job vacancies.

Do you have any theories about this post? Let me know what you’re thinking on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Kojima is putting on a special 10th anniversary show

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Complete Borderlands 4 Trophy List—How to Get All Achievements And Trophies
item.content:encoded:
For the first time since 2019, the Borderlands franchise is back with a new mainline game in Borderlands 4. Like all games in the series, there are a number of trophies and achievements to unlock as you play through Borderlands 4.

The fifth installment of the main series, Borderlands 4 takes place six years after the events of Borderlands 3 on the planet Kairos. As a new Vault Hunter, you will travel through every region of the planet, leading the resistance against the planet’s Dictator, Timekeeper.

More Borderlands 4: EXCLUSIVE: Randy Pitchford Admits He’s ‘A Little Nervous’ About The More Challenging Parts of Borderlands 4

Without any more delay, let’s take a look at the full list of achievements and trophies on Borderlands 4. A quick note, the list may involve some slight spoilers from the game, so consider this your warning if you want things to remain a surprise.

All Borderlands 4 Achievements & Trophies

In order to unlock every trophy and achievement in Borderlands 4, your going to have to reach higher levels, collect every personal vehicle possible, find every map location, and more. Because of this, and the nature of the Borderlands series itself, there seems to be no limit to the replayability of the game

How Many Achievements And Trophies Are In The Game??

For the completionist in all of us, there are 35 trophies and achievements to unlock in Borderlands 4. It’s not the longest list of extras, but it’s still nothing to scoff at—especially when you look at all you need to do in order to unlock some of them.

Are you going to try and 100% Borderlands 4 now that you know all of the game’s achievements and trophies? Let us know down below, and join even more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter. 

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Schedule 1’s New Community Vote Features Drivers, Shrooms and More
item.content:encoded:
Schedule 1’s Community Vote 2 is now live, and players can choose between Hireable Drivers, Fishing, and Shrooms for the next major update.

Schedule 1 developers are building the game for the community, hosting new community votes for every upcoming major update. In the last vote, players had the option to choose between Rival Cartels, Police Expansion, and Shrooms, and after the voting period was over, the update finally arrived in August 2025. Now, a second round of voting has begun for new features in Schedule 1.

From today, September 1, to the upcoming weekend, Schedule 1 players will be able to participate in Community Vote 2 through the game’s main menu. The results will be announced shortly after the voting period is over, and they will also be displayed in the main menu.

Shrooms Return

The new community vote brings back Shrooms as an option. This feature will allow players to manufacture and distribute a new drug type, Magic Mushrooms. The update will feature the “funky new drug”, unique equipment, new effects, and a new supplier.

Fishing Minigame

One of the newer options in the community vote is Fishing, which will introduce a fishing minigame. If this option wins the vote, players will be able to “reel in fish (and maybe some other special items)” that can be sold at Randy’s Bait & Tackle. Moreover, the update will introduce new ingredients and effects.

Hireable Drivers

Lastly, we have a feature focused on convenience in Schedule 1’s community vote, specifically for hireable drivers. If this feature wins the vote, players will be able to transport items between their properties, businesses, and dealers. Moreover, players can designate automatic transit routes and specify the required conditions (e.g., number of items in the vehicle) for a route to begin. The update will also bring some QOL improvements to the delivery system.

In other news, we are yet to hear more about Schedule 1’s console port since the update in April 2025. Which feature will you be voting for in Schedule 1’s community vote 2? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming forums discussion.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about the Saints Row reboot starting out as a direct sequel to Saints Row: The Third. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter. 

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Two New AMD Ryzen CPUs Spotted At Online Retailer
item.content:encoded:
It looks like AMD is getting ready to add two CPUs to its current-gen Ryzen lineup. Spotted at an online retailer, the AMD Ryzen 5 9500F and Ryzen 7 9700F are new processors seemingly launching in the coming weeks or months.

Both are Granite Ridge CPUs for the AM5 socket, meaning that they will work with current AM5-compatible motherboards.

While full details on the new CPUs aren’t yet known, some specifications have surfaced. According to online listings, the Ryzen 5 9500F is expected to feature 6 cores and 12 threads, with a maximum clock speed of 5.0 GHz. It will reportedly include 38MB of cache and a 65W TDP.

The Ryzen 7 9700F, meanwhile, is listed as an 8-core, 12-thread CPU with a 65W TDP. Neither processor will include integrated graphics, as indicated by the “F” designation.

More PC Parts: Nvidia Cuts Prices Of RTX 50-Series GPUs In Europe

As far as pricing goes, that remains up in the air. Shop BLT has the AMD Ryzen 5 9500F lists for $217 while the Ryzen 7 9700F is priced at $294. That said, with the state of the market and changes happening, seemingly, daily, no pricing information can be viewed as certain.

It’s important to note that while these retail listings may be accurate, the specifications are not confirmed. Until AMD provides official details, all of this information should be taken with a grain of salt. As of publishing, AMD has no events scheduled to announce its new processors.

AMD hasn’t responded to requests for comment on the new CPUs or when consumers can expect to see them released. Should a response come in, this article will be updated.

For more Insider Gaming, check out our review of the MSI Titan 18 HX AI laptop, the ultimate gaming laptop with some flaws. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter. 

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: Rocksteady Hires Former Assassin’s Creed Director For Same Role
item.content:encoded:
Rocksteady is looking at the head of a popular franchise to guide its next game into the future. According to his personal LinkedIn profile, Bill Money has been working as game director at Rocksteady Studios since July 2025.

He joins the studio after spending 10 years at Ubisoft Singapore in the same role.

During his time with Ubisoft, Money led Assassin’s Creed Mirage, Valhalla, it’s Siege of Paris DLC, and Origins. Prior to Ubisoft, he was a creative director at Darkside Game Studios and a design director at WB Games Montreal. At WB Games, Money worked on Batman: Arkham Origins.

While it hasn’t been confirmed what game Money will be directing, it’s believed to be the studio’s next Batman game. Rocksteady hasn’t released a mainline Batman game since 2015’s Batman: Arkham Knight. Since then, they released Batman: Arkham VR for PC and PS4 in 2016 and Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League in 2023.

Earlier this year the studio laid off an unknown number of staff as support for Suicide Squad wrapped up.

As far as Batman is concerned, Warner Bros. has gone on the record multiple times stating that it was going to focus on its biggest IPs moving forward. The next Batman game, whenever that comes, isn’t the only Batman title coming, either. LEGO Batman: Legacy of The Dark Knight was announced at Gamescom Opening Night Live 2025, and is expected to release sometime in 2026.

What do you think the future of Batman games holds, and do you think Money is a good choice to lead the next game as director at Rocksteady? Let us know down below, and take the discussion further in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out new leaked gameplay of the upcoming free-to-play Battlefield 6 Battle Royale mode and find out how CD Projekt Red continues to grow with Cyberpunk 2 and The Witcher 4 work continuing. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: All Roblox Anime Vanguards Codes & Rewards—Every August 2025 Active Code
item.content:encoded:
Anime Vanguards is a popular anime game in Roblox. Here is every active and expired code for the game this month.

Anime Vanguards is a traditional anime game in Roblox that lets players spin to win. Like so many other anime games in Roblox, the game also helps you gain an advantage by using reward codes.

We’ve gathered all the active reward codes this month, and we’ll also keep track of all of the expired ones. This way, you’ll always know which ones can be used and which ones are no longer active.

Every Active Roblox Anime Vanguards Code & Reward (August 2025)

Below, you can find all of the active codes for August 2025.

Most codes expire over time, so make sure you use them before they do.

How to Redeem Roblox Anime Vanguards Codes

To redeem codes, just follow the steps below:

  1. Launch Roblox and then the Anime Vanguards game.
  2. Select the ‘Codes’ option on the left side of the screen.
  3. Type in the code you want, and press ‘Redeem’.

If the code is still active, then you’ll receive the reward. Remember, you can only use a code once.

All Expired Roblox Anime Vanguards Codes

As of August 2025, we can confirm that the codes listed below have all expired.

Sometimes, expired Roblox codes are brought back. So, it’s always worth giving them a try. Some may still work with some accounts where they were never redeemed.

Where to Find Roblox Anime Vanguards Codes

While you’re here, make sure you bookmark this page if you want to always know which codes are active and which have expired. That’s because we keep it updated as and when new codes arrive.

Brand new codes tend to appear first on the game’s official Discord server. This is another great way to get codes first.

Love anime Roblox games? Then be sure to check out our Insider Gaming forum, where you can start up some fun new discussions about the best games.

If you’re a fan of anime Roblox adventures, you can also check out our code guides for Steal an Anime, Mobile Legends, and Anime Card Clash.
